newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: France biggest opponent of transparency mechanism.
newsitem.headline: France biggest opponent of transparency mechanism.

text.p: France emerged as the biggest opponent at Friday's Internal Market Council of the Commission's proposed mechanism for ensuring unnecessary legislation on things like protection of minors and pornography does not hinder the free flow of services in the information society.
"The French had the strongest opposition," said one EU diplomat, saying that Belgium followed close behind. Ireland was the biggest supporter.
France said the issues -- which will relate to future moves into telecommunications markets -- had not been properly defined.
But the Commission said it was unwilling to define things too closely as the mechanism will apply to forms of communication which are as yet not known.

Sweden, the Netherlands and Denmark expressed concerns that the mechanism could be a potential obstacle to the free flow of services, while Sweden also feared it could impede free access to information.
Under the Commission Communication and proposed directive EU members would be obliged to notify the Commission of proposed legislation. It could then be discussed by member states.
If necessary, legislation could be proposed on the basis of problems which occurred.
